node.doctext:
This is a storage node for CST reviews. Reviews are moved her from our working area in [CST_Chat].

This archive begins on 06/07/2006, When it's full we'll move to [CST_Storage_22].

See also CST Storage collabs [CST_Storage_1|1] - [CST_Storage_20|20].

Batch Processed 06/07/2006

Writeup Title: [reality hacking]
Author: [brainwave ]
Reviewer: [GrouchyOldMan]
Public domain?: No
Original Author's Permission received?: No
Quoted content less than 33%: No
Compliance Assessment: No
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes: 2006.05.30 at 17:37 jessicapierce says brainwave's wu in reality hacking
Hi there, Bad news I'm afraid. This writeup doesn't appear to be compliant with the [E2 FAQ: Copyrighted Material|E2 Copyright Policy]. For fair use compliance the quote should be 33% or less of the total wordcount. So, unless you have permission from the author to post it here, or believe that it's in the Public Domain I have to remove it. If you want to add more original text and repost I'll be glad to assist you. Cheers.
Tc = 182, Tq = 100, %q= 55%

Writeup Title: [Towel Day]
Author: [Semisane]
Reviewer: [GrouchyOldMan]
Public domain?: No
Original Author's Permission received?: No
Quoted content less than 33%: No
Compliance Assessment: No
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes: 2006.05.23 at 01:22 jessicapierce says Hi there - would you mind taking a look at Semisane's Towel Day ? In its original form it was about 50-50 original-lifted text, so I msged and asked him nicely to either cut down the quote or expand his own text. He was unexpectedly kind of snippy with me about it, and refuses to answer my further msges. He has since added a bit to his own text, but it's still not up to code. Help?
Hi there, with your recent addition of original text, this writeup is now compliant with the [E2 Copyright Changes|E2 copyright policy] and you may add the [CST Approved] tag to it. Cheers.
Tc = 967, Tq = 302, %q= 31%

Author: [Major General Panic]
Reviewer: [GrouchyOldMan]

Original Author's Permission received?: No
Quoted content less than 33%: No
Compliance Assessment: Yes
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes: 2006.05.14 at 19:21 jessicapierce says MGP's Soul Love
Hi there, I'm reviewing this writeup for compliance with the [E2 FAQ: Copyrighted Material|E2 Copyright Policy]. If I'm not mistaken, this is your original translation of the lyrics, which makes it an original work and not subject to copyright. Is that correct?
2006-05-26 (8.2 hr) [Major General Panic] says It is mine. Sorry for not responding, but I haven't logged in in a while. However, you may remove it anyway — public opinion seems to be that either it sucks, or some such. I should really remove the copyright thing from it. I know nothing about copyright law, and I'm not sure why I put it in there in the first place. Tc = 303, Tq = 0, %q= 70%

Author:[Codger]
Reviewer: [Lometa]
Public domain?: No. Recipes found [http://mikelietz.org/etc/recipe1|here] and [http://fooddownunder.com/cgi-bin/recipe.cgi?r=184598|here]. Accessed May 3, 2006.
Original Author's Permission received?: No.
Quoted content less than 33%: recipe 1=22% recipe 2=45%
Compliance Assessment: No.
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes: 2006-04-26@2:26 [jessicapierce] says [Codger]'s wu in [recipe] - I am of the understanding that wording can be copyrighted, although lists of ingredients cannot. Is this one ok?
Hello Codger, Unfortunately because of the [E2 copyright changes] copyrighted work can no longer be kept in the data base. If you would like to update this and resubmit it you may want to read through [US Copyright for Recipes] If you have any questions Codger please feel free to ask me or any of the editors.
Hi Jessica, Just a note to let you know that you are right about the copyright on recipes. Coder’s has been removed from the [recipe] node. Thanks for the heads up!

Writeup Title: ['Oh, Whistle, and I'll Come to You, My Lad']
Author: [paraclete]
Reviewer: [GrouchyOldMan]
Public domain?: Yes
Original Author's Permission received?: No
Quoted content less than 33%: No
Compliance Assessment: Yes
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes: 2006.04.24 at 14:03 paraclete says Hi... Inspired by rootbeer, I was wanting to node the works of M. R. James (yes, I've already nicked the username :D ). His stuff's fallen out of copyright in the US, and there are already sites that are hosting his stuff. However, it doesn't run out in Europe till 01/01/07, and since I live in Europe, I've got no idea whether or not I can start posting them now, or if I have to wait till the beginning of next year (which would actually give me time to format the bastards!)...
/msg paraclete Hi there, E2 uses American law as a basis for our copyright policy. So, if the author of the work died at least 70 years ago, or if the work was published before 1923, regardless of the author's death-date, it's in the [Public Domain]. Drop me a msg when you do the first few and I'll give them a [CST Approved|Review] and notify the Admins. Cheers.
2006-04-25 (2.3 min) paraclete says I've dropped the first few - both were posted under M. R. James (and both were first published before 1923). Thanks for the advice!
Hi again. This looks great. You can add the [CST Approved] tag if you like.
Tc = 346, Tq = 235, %q= 68%

Writeup Title: [World Charter for Prostitutes' Rights]
Author: [stand/alone/bitch]
Reviewer: [GrouchyOldMan]
Public domain?: Yes
Original Author's Permission received?: No
Quoted content less than 33%: No
Compliance Assessment: Yes
Review Request (w/timestamp) & Notes: 2006.06.13 at 04:44 jessicapierce says World Charter for Prostitutes' Rights

Hi there, I'm reviewing this writeup for compliance with the [E2 Copyright Changes|E2 copyright policy]. Clearly the original source text is in the public domain, but you haven't credited the translator of the work. Who did the translation (Berenger Sauniere?) and is it also in the public domain? Author contacted to clarity the author and copyright status of the translation 06.01.06
2006-06-02 (1.1 hr) soytari says thx a lot, i found stg: http://www.connectotel.com/rennes/serpmwch.html, it is translated by Translated by Marcus Williamson and Corella Hughes. But I really don't know it's in public domain or not... i suppose it's from 1920's or so. sorry,wait! http://www.connectotel.com/rennes/serpnote/serpf.htm, says that it's published in 1999, but no copy rights have been written about. what do you say? what shall i do? Thx... I added the translation credts, just in case. Thx!
Well this is an interesting dilemma, if the translation was done in 1999, we must assume that it's under copyright protection. Your options are: 1) Do your own original translation, 2) Reduce the size of the quote and add original commentary text to meet the Fair Use requirements 3) Find another translation that's not copyrighted 4) Let me remove the writeup. My recommendation would be to remove it and repost it once you've resolved the issues. There's a very interesting story here, tell it to us. Let me know what you want to do...
2006-06-02 (3.6 min) jessicapierce says Hi there! Thanks for the update on Serpent Rouge. Just so you know, that user is a tad... wily. He has plagiarized in the past. Most recently I spoke with him about a wu which was not quite plagiarism, but a pretty shoddy rewrite of the Wiki article. I tactfully pointed out that his source was showing, and eventually he replied and says he'll work on it.But in the meantime he ignored numerous msges,blaming the difference in our time zones for his delay (true, but he logged on a half-dozen times in the interim!) - anyway, just letting you know, he doesn't seem to relish doing any homework, or communicating much with eds.
/msg jessicapierce Gracias amigacita, I encouraged him to fix, but come Monday it's either fixed or gone.
Tc = 182, Tq = 100, %q= 55%
